page.title: 20HOUSING IN CHITTERNE
page.content: In the West Wiltshire Rural District Policy Statement, Chitterne qualifies for limited residential development. The local view is that small scale housing should be encouraged and the Structure Plan for the area allows for infill housing only. House prices are increasing and a few properties are on the market. There are several quite large old houses in this northern part of Chitterne, one having been built as a 17th Century hunting lodge, and another includes the remnants of a 16th Century Priory and St. Andrew's Chapel, with a stone arched gateway into the courtyard. Nearly all the houses are privately owned although there are some Local Aurhority and Ministry of Defence houses on lease.
